result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Destroyed fingerprint card

Defendant appeared with counsel SPD William Poss.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Attorney Poss states his client will plead to Count 1 in the amended information and will enter into a post plea diversion agreement; will also plead to Count 2 with a joint recommendation for sentencing; 14CF143 is to be dismissed and read-in.  Judge reviews the charges/penalties in the amended information.  Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1 and Count 2.  Court reviews elements/plea questionnaire/waiver of rights and felony warning given.  Court also reviews post plea diversion agreement and terms of the agreement.  Defense stips to factual basis in amended information.  Court makes a finding that the defendant understands the proceedings, freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waives his rights and enters his pleas.  Court withholds finding on Count 1 and finds guilty of Count 2.  14CF143 is dismissed and read-in.  Court makes a change to paragraph 2E in the diversion agreement by adding "excluding female relatives."  State agrees with amendment.  Victim's grandmother and father present and both make statements.  Attorney Poss makes statement following their statements.  Defendant excercises his right to allocution.  Judge explaines the testing used by the Doctor and the results found to the victim's family.  Sentence withheld and placed on 2 years sex offender probation with following conditions:  Must sign a release of information to allow probation agent to review the report by Dr. Yackovich of Midwest Center for Psychotherapy and Sex Therapy; Must comply with any recommendations for programming by his probation agent and must comply with any recommendations and must sign and releases of information for agent to verify compliance with programming; must have no contact with any females under the age of 18 unless they are blood relatives or prior permission is obtained from probation agent; must get prior approval from agent before any dating relationship established; must prepare a written update as stated in the Diversion Agreement every 3 months to be given to the District Attorney; not allowed on premises of any schools if any females under age 18 are present without prior approval of probation agent; when agent deems appropriate defendant must prepare a report to be given to agent regarding the affect this has had on the defendant's life and the victim's life and how he could have made better choices; must have no contact with the victim or her family members; Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge; pay a fine of $100 plus court costs; Must seek and/or maintain full-time employment or a combination of employment and education which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  You must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent;  may apply for expungement if probation successfully completed and all court obligations are satisfied.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-21-2015 03:30 pm

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Poss.  Attorney Poss stated that he has received his expert's report that he will share with ADA Inlow.  Attorney Poss will also file a sentencing brief.  Plea/sentencing to be scheduled for 1 hour.
Status conference at 03-16-2015 03:00 pm

ADA Inlow appeared on behalf of the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Attorney Poss may move to return defendant's other open case back to Judge Becker.  Inlow indicated that she intends to dismiss and read in this case when 13CF128 is sentenced.  STC set for 3/16/15.
